We must turn to Christ in some lonely hour, when some crisis has delivered us from the hard crust of our ordinary thoughtS, and has shown us in a flash our own forlorn and insecure position; we must go to Christ in an hour when for some reason our heart and flesh is crying out, before we are in a position to say what, in the matter of Deity, Christ is, and whether there is anything in the matter of Deity that He is not. For the Divinity of Jesus Christ was a Discovery of the Soul before it became a Doctrine of the Chureh: and that is still the

sound and beautiful order.
